div.p: Haplotype describe a set of genomic variations that appear on a single strand of DNA - and which are therefore typically inherited together. Many haplotypes are expressed as simple strings, and can be conveyed in valueCodeableConcept.text. In some cases, haplotypes are sufficiently standardized to be conveyed as codes in valueCodeableConcept.code.
Review the Genotypes page for guidance on reporting genotypes and haplotypes together.
